author: Special Correspondent
text:
A trial run of the newly constructed car of the Sri Lakshmi Narasimman temple at Singirikudi in Cuddalore district was held on Sunday.

Many devotees witnessed the movement of the car chanting the name of the Lordy.

Abishekam was done to the the new car and an aarthi was performed before it was pulled.

Fitted with iron wheels, the car was taken around the streets before being brought back to the stand.

The trial run is a prelude to car festival to be conducted on May 20 (the last time the festival was celebrated was in 2005).

There are inscriptions indicating the temple was originally built in the 3rd Century AD.

Later constructions were added during Narasimha Pallava II ’s reign and Krishna Deva Raya’s visit to this temple.

The temple is being administered by Department of Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowment(HR&CE), Tamil Nadu.

According to the stalapuraman of the temple, the king, Nimi Chakravarthy cursed sage Vasishta to lose his identity and wander in the atmosphere without a body.

\On the advice of Brahma, the sage proceeded to Singirikudi and performed tapas propitiating Narasimha.

The sage thus attained salvation through penance and the Gods gave him darshan.

This place is called Singarkudi with the presiding deity being Singaperumal or Narasimha who has 16 hands. The Lord’s birth star Swathi is celebrated on a grand scale.
title: Trial run of Singirikudi temple car held
